examples: This year the orchard had an abundant apple crop.
Clean water is not abundant in arid regions.

definition: Very dry with little or no rain; too dry for most plants to grow.
examples: Cacti grow well in arid climates.
The soil was too arid for crops.

extra.memory_tip: Arid = ‘air’ is all you get—no water.

definition: Clearly different; easy to see, hear, or understand.
examples: There is a distinct smell of rain.
Those two species are distinct.

definition: To feed on grass; to scrape the skin and cause a slight injury.
examples: Sheep graze on the hillside. (verb)
He fell and got a small graze on his knee. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Graze = grass for animals; graze = a grazing scratch.

definition: Very busy and full of activity; rushed.
examples: Mondays can be hectic in the office.
It was a hectic week before the exams.

extra.memory_tip: Hectic = a heck of a lot to do!

definition: A large crowd or group, often moving together.
examples: A horde of tourists arrived at noon.
Locust hordes can destroy crops quickly.

extra.memory_tip: Horde = more than a horde-inary crowd.

definition: Warm and damp; having a lot of moisture in the air.
examples: It felt hot and humid after the storm.
Tropical forests are humid environments.

extra.memory_tip: Humid = heavy, humid air hugs you.

examples: The view from the peak was incredible.
She told an incredible story of survival.
Penguins inhabit cold coastal regions.
Few people inhabit the high desert.

extra.memory_tip: Inhabit = have it ‘in’ as your habitat.

definition: A piece of land almost surrounded by water or sticking out into water.
examples: The peninsula shelters the harbour.
Spain and Portugal share the Iberian Peninsula.

extra.memory_tip: Peninsula = ‘pen’ of land in the sea.

definition: Relating to the countryside rather than the town or city.
examples: Rural roads are narrow and quiet.
She prefers rural life to city living.

extra.memory_tip: Rural = fields, farms, and fresh air.

definition: A safe place; a protected area for wildlife; a holy place.
examples: The reserve is a sanctuary for rare birds.
She found sanctuary in her grandmother’s home.
The palace shone in all its splendour.
Autumn forests are a display of natural splendour.

definition: Very dirty and unpleasant conditions, often due to poverty or neglect.
examples: They escaped the squalor of the slums.
The house fell into squalor after years of neglect.

definition: The features of a stretch of land, especially its surface and type.
examples: Hikers studied the rocky terrain.
The race crosses varied terrain, from sand to forest.
